question: A patient reports their antidepressant is no longer working after 2 years of effective treatment. What phenomenon is this called?
rationale: Collaborative care: integrated behavioral health in primary care. Improves access, outcomes. Psychiatric consultation, care management. (IMPACT Model)

question: During a mental status exam, a patient states: 'I went to the store, the door, the floor, explore.' This is an example of which thought process disturbance?
rationale: Measurement-based care: use rating scales (PHQ-9, GAD-7) track symptoms, guide treatment. Improves outcomes. Document scores. (APA)

question: What is the minimum duration of symptoms required to diagnose Persistent Depressive Disorder (Dysthymia) in adults?
rationale: Recovery-oriented care: person-centered, strengths-based. Hope, empowerment, meaningful life beyond symptoms. Shared decision-making. (SAMHSA)
